text: <@U2H3TT8F2> Thanks! Looking forward to having the way to talk about the learning process of HS Academy :slightly_smiling_face:

Switching a website over from the original Drag and drop pages to the new theme templates that I made. I am trying to clone pages in content staging and switch over the templates that way, but I am noticing that none of the theme templates are showing up when I try to do so.

Note that the templates are showing up as an option to select when I create a new, blank staged page. Is this expected behavior? Can we not swap templates from a legacy drag and drop template to a theme template? Do we need to make a blank page starting with the theme template and then copy/paste content into it?

Hey there BJ

See Migration on this page:
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/building-blocks/templates/drag-and-drop-areas#migration>

Further migration related content:
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/tutorials/add-theme-features-to-existing-sites>

Has the rich text editor started stripping out `script` tags? I have a page that was saved a few days ago that had a script tag in the rich text editor source view, but now if I go to edit it (or re-add the script), the source view is just empty.
(I know that it would be better to make a custom module. I didn't make this page.)
:wave: Greetings would you provide a link to the page where this is happening?

Anyone ever ran into HubSpot-generated cookie banners behaving strangely on iOS Safari specifically in landscape? There seems to be some kind of React style injection that's preventing us from overriding the style to keep font sizes consistent.
